children.text: The variables lprev and rprev track whether the previous and next elements were different before the update. Then after the update, laftr and raftr track the new differences. The delta dl and dr are the changes in transitions at the left and right of the updated position. The code then adds dl*(i-1)*(n -i +1) and dr*(i)*(n -i).
children.label: code_analysis

children.text: Wait, perhaps the formula for the contribution of a transition at position i is (i) * (n - i +1). So when a transition is added or removed, the total awe changes by that amount. So in the initial code, when the element at position i is changed, the code checks the transitions before and after the change.
children.label: mental_execution

children.text: The dl is the change in the left transition (between i-1 and i), and dr is the change in the right transition (between i and i+1). The problem is in the initial setup. The code for the else clause (when arr[i] == arr[i-1]) is missing.
children.label: bug_fixing
